channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: Free Trade Ideas? Sign Me Up!
item.description:
Introducing Alpha Boost, the new trade idea subscription service from the Quiet Foundation. A simple sign up will provide 3 emails per week to your inbox of 5-to-10 option trade ideas that are generated from a proprietary trade hunting system. Best of all, it’s free!

Join Tom, TP and Jermal as they preview the new Alpha Boost service and check out the trade ideas it generates.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Introducing Alpha Boost, the new trade idea subscription service from the Quiet Foundation. A simple sign up will provide 3 emails per week to your inbox of 5-to-10 option trade ideas that are generated from a proprietary trade hunting system. Bes...
item.content:encoded:
Introducing Alpha Boost, the new trade idea subscription service from the Quiet Foundation. A simple sign up will provide 3 emails per week to your inbox of 5-to-10 option trade ideas that are generated from a proprietary trade hunting system. Best of all, it’s free!

Join Tom, TP and Jermal as they preview the new Alpha Boost service and check out the trade ideas it generates.

item.title: Are Quad Witching Days Special?
item.description: Despite popular speculation, quad witching days were statistically no different to random market days in terms of average moves, volatility, and price ranges. Although volume tends to increase on these days, there is no tradable edge to be taken advantage.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Despite popular speculation, quad witching days were statistically no different to random market days in terms of average moves, volatility, and price ranges. Although volume tends to increase on these days, there is no tradable edge to be taken a...
item.content:encoded: Despite popular speculation, quad witching days were statistically no different to random market days in terms of average moves, volatility, and price ranges. Although volume tends to increase on these days, there is no tradable edge to be taken advantage.

item.title: Volume and Volatility
item.description: tastytraders know that periods of high volatility are opportunities for selling premium. High volatility tends to go hand in hand with high trade volume. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see if paying attention to volume can give us any insight into upcoming volatility changes.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: tastytraders know that periods of high volatility are opportunities for selling premium. High volatility tends to go hand in hand with high trade volume. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see if paying attention to volume can give us any ins...

Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see if paying attention to volume can give us any insight into upcoming volatility changes.

item.title: Placing Bets on the Volatility of Sports Betting
item.description:
The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led to added interest in the gambling and casino stock space. 

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they seek out opportunities to trade volatility in the sports betting industry.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led...
item.content:encoded:
The curtain is coming down on the rules and regulations surrounding sports betting in the United States. Consideration of sports betting legislation as dual track proposals - federal and state - have increased in frequency since 2017. This has led to added interest in the gambling and casino stock space. 

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they seek out opportunities to trade volatility in the sports betting industry.

item.title: Trading Volatility ETFs Can Be a Drag
item.description:
The VIX is a measure of 30-day forward volatility in the S&P 500. In short, people trade VIX futures and options when they want to make bets on the rise or fall of overall market volatility. Volatility (Leveraged) ETFs offer another way do the same thing. They track VIX futures, therefore, in times of contango they tend to decay due to the subsequent roll from first to second month.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as break down the concept of volatility drag and the effect it has on volatility ETFs that track the VIX.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The VIX is a measure of 30-day forward volatility in the S&P 500. In short, people trade VIX futures and options when they want to make bets on the rise or fall of overall market volatility. Volatility (Leveraged) ETFs offer another way do the sam...
item.content:encoded:
The VIX is a measure of 30-day forward volatility in the S&P 500. In short, people trade VIX futures and options when they want to make bets on the rise or fall of overall market volatility. Volatility (Leveraged) ETFs offer another way do the same thing. They track VIX futures, therefore, in times of contango they tend to decay due to the subsequent roll from first to second month.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as break down the concept of volatility drag and the effect it has on volatility ETFs that track the VIX.

item.title: Crypto Indifference
item.description: When determining which crypto to trade or observe for a portfolio, the notion of product indifference we use for trading options applies here as well. The risk-return of different cryptocurriences differs only in the volatility of their prices; since the tail risks and symmetry of price moves are nearly identical across most of the major cryptos, what you trade does not matter nearly as much as how much you trade.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: When determining which crypto to trade or observe for a portfolio, the notion of product indifference we use for trading options applies here as well. The risk-return of different cryptocurriences differs only in the volatility of their prices; si...

The risk-return of different cryptocurriences differs only in the volatility of their prices; since the tail risks and symmetry of price moves are nearly identical across most of the major cryptos, what you trade does not matter nearly as much as how much you trade.

item.title: Probability of Contraction
item.description: Waiting for high IVR can increase our chances of seeing an IV contraction during the life of a trade. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how high IVR and the probability of IV contraction have related historically and compare the differences between ETFs and equities.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Waiting for high IVR can increase our chances of seeing an IV contraction during the life of a trade. Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how high IVR and the probability of IV contraction have related historically and compare the differen...

Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how high IVR and the probability of IV contraction have related historically and compare the differences between ETFs and equities.

item.title: Who's Afraid of the Tapering Wolf?
item.description:
The Fed’s Jackson Hole summit begins today and there’s many questions surrounding when the central bank will cut its asset purchases. While this action theoretically should inspire confidence in the economy, the sentiment in the market this week has been skittish. What does this mean for stocks and volatility?

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they glance at how market indicators have moved and ponder on potential changes in volatility ahead.

item.title: Standard Deviation Simplified
item.description: The term “standard deviation” is common in options trading. It can be used to describe probability, movement, or distance from ATM. Join Tom and Tony today as they explain in detail!
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The term “standard deviation” is common in options trading. It can be used to describe probability, movement, or distance from ATM. Join Tom and Tony today as they explain in detail!

item.title: The Risk in Defined Risk
item.description: Defined-risk trades can be useful for placing trades using less buying power. But how much of that buying power are we likely to lose when the trades go wrong? Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much risk we are really putting on when we put on defined-risk trades.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Defined-risk trades can be useful for placing trades using less buying power. But how much of that buying power are we likely to lose when the trades go wrong? Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much risk we are really putting on when...

Today, Tom and Tony look at the data to see how much risk we are really putting on when we put on defined-risk trades.

item.title: Oddly Large Vol Contractions
item.description: Friday’s move in cash VIX represented the top 1% of VIX declines since 1990. Friday’s move in the S&P 500 index was unusually small given the move in volatility: 90% of those 1% VIX down moves saw a bigger move in the stock market than we saw on Friday.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
